entry.title: OptiReUse, a decision support tool for wastewater reuse in agriculture irrigation based on Life Cycle Assessment results (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)
entry.content:

Biard, Yannick; Kalboussi, Nesrine, 2021, "OptiReUse, a decision support tool for wastewater reuse in agriculture irrigation based on Life Cycle Assessment results", https://doi.org/10.18167/DVN1/YLP1BA, CIRAD Dataverse, V4, UNF:6:GdahnlvAM+8Z+h24Gnd2kQ== [fileUNF]
This decision support tool was designed to evaluate the environment efficiency of wastewater reuse for agriculture irrigation among other options. The aim of this decision support tool is to guide the interpretation of LCA results by reducing, gradually, the non-discriminant impa...

entry.title: Landscape matrix map at 2.2 5km2 scale of a 84 km2 part of the Vavatenina District, Analanjirofo Region, Madagascar, 2019 (Newly published Datasets from Cirad Dataverse)

This map gives the spatial distribution of the major land use in a cell of 1500km x 1500 km=2.25 km2, also called the landscape matrix, over an area of study of landscape dynamics in Madagascar. It consists of an area of 84 square kilometers located at the West of Vavatenina town...

This dataset contains all data collected during a 3 year-survey around Montpellier to study the breeding phenology and breeding success of the anuran Pelodytes punctatus.

entry.title: Centifolia Lookbook SS22. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
COLLECTIONS

Centifolia Lookbook SS22. Created with local inspiration from Grasse, Provence’s perfume capital, Café du Cycliste’s new Centifolia collection is blooming with cultivated colour. Ride into summer smelling the flowers, and magically transport yourself to perfumed Provence.

entry.title: A Rose by Any Other Name. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
COLLECTIONS

A Rose by Any Other Name. A stone’s throw from the birthplace of Café du Cycliste, Grasse is the French capital of perfume and rose cultivation. The Centifolia is known as the Provence Rose, and is a gift from the land of the region.

entry.title: Guillaume Néry: Diving in at the Café. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA MAISON

Guillaume Néry: Diving in at the Café. It took five magical minutes to understand the dimension of free-diving champion and Caravan member, Guillaume Néry. To watch him sit and hold his breath for five minutes was a drop in the ocean on the way to understanding what’s required in this super-human sport.

entry.title: Anton Krupicka: Farwell to Winter. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA MAISON

Anton Krupicka: Farwell to Winter. It is said that the ride should be about the journey, not the destination. However, for Anton Krupicka and Hailey Moore, a recent trip in the Colorado mountains proved it’s about both.

entry.title: The Best Brasucade in the World. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA VIE

The Best Brasucade in the World. A meal at the end of exploring the Camargue, home to flamboyant flamingoes and brooding bulls. Fresh Mediterranean mussels from the local fishing port, with a sauce made of olive oil, herbs and Pastis.

entry.title: Ride & Create: Pierre Léopold. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA VIE

Ride & Create: Pierre Léopold. Pierre is a specialist in Drosophila, the fruit fly that is used to understand genetics. Outside the laboratory, cycling is for Pierre essential, and he explains to us that riding and research form a complementary whole.

entry.title: The Lozère: Hellhound on the Trail. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
ROULER

The Lozère: Hellhound on the Trail. Lozère in the Massif Central is typical of France Profonde. Connected by quiet and winding roads, there is very little traffic, a cyclist’s dream. One question, why is it so deserted?

entry.title: Ride of the Month: March. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA MAISON

Ride of the Month: March. In the world of cycle racing, Milan–San Remo is one of the most prestigious events of the season. To win this trophy is to have your name chiseled into history. But only if you’re a man.

entry.title: Coins Cachés: Lago di Como. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
ROULER

Coins Cachés: Lago di Como. At the convergence of the Lombardian flatlands and Italian alps lies Lago di Como. Beyond the glamourous waterside, there are roads leading to hundreds of wonderful divergences.

entry.title: Ride of the Month: February. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA MAISON

Ride of the Month: February. The Tour des Alpes Maritimes is an early test for hill racers. But we ourselves are not here to race. We’re here to discover what the Riviera has to offer the amateur cyclist.

entry.title: Caravan: Anton Krupicka (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
LA MAISON

Caravan: Anton Krupicka I enjoy the adventure of cycling, especially bike packing, the multi-day trips. For me though, it’s just being in the outdoors, seeing beautiful landscapes and using your body.

entry.title: The Camargue – Between Sky and Sea. (La Gazette de café du cycliste)
entry.content:
ROULER

The Camargue – Between Sky and Sea. There are places in the world that are sanctuaries for nature, where wildlife is untouched by modern life. The Camargue is one of those special places.

entry.title: Lost and Found Gravel Returns for 2022 (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
entry.content:
Lost and Found Gravel Returns for 2022

Sierra Buttes Trail Stewardship has announced that the Lost and Found Gravel Festival will return in 2022, in partnership with long-time cycling production team, Breakaway Promotions. Lost and Found will run on June 4th, 2022, and the proposed routes will feature a 100-mile route with 8,447 feet of elevation gain. Shorter 35 and 60-mile routes are also available.

Read More
NewsDave MalwitzMarch 17, 2022gravel race, lost and found gravel, sbts, sbts gravel event, breakaway promotions, portola 0 Comments

entry.title: Ergon Announces New Gravel Bar Tape (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
entry.content:
Ergon Announces New Gravel Bar Tape

Here at Gravelstoke we are huge fans of Ergon, a German brand that creates high-quality products for MTB and road with special attention to ergonomics. Ergon has now moved to the cockpit with the launch of drop-bar-specific products for improved comfort including a remastered CF seatpost, BT Bartapes, and Orthocell® under-tape inserts.

Read More
NewsDave MalwitzMarch 16, 2022ergon, best handlebar tape, best bar tape, bar tape, handlebar tape 0 Comments

entry.title: Film: 72 Hours In Patagonia AZ (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
entry.content:
Film: 72 Hours In Patagonia AZ

Nestled just 18 miles north of the Mexican Border, Patagonia is in the heart of the Desert Southwest and up until recently, has been one of the best-kept secrets for gravel riding over the past decade. Just one of the smattering of towns in the San Rafael Valley, Patagonia is suffused with Sonoran culture that brings a unique blend of sights, sounds, smells, and traditions to the region.

Read More
Videos, ReportsDave MalwitzMarch 11, 2022enve, ventum, patagonia az 0 Comments

The certified B Corp cycling apparel company Kitsbow announced today the all-new Madrone Short specifically designed by women, for women. The Madrone is clearly characterized by clean lines, a slim fit, and added utility with 2 ergonomically placed back pockets with a security zipper.

entry.title: Otay Mountain Gravel Adventure Guide (Gravel Cycling Gear Blog — Gravelstoke)
entry.content:
Otay Mountain Gravel Adventure Guide

The Otay Mountain Wilderness is located in San Diego, CA and the area is a great location to explore on a gravel bike with its long dirt road climbs and terrific views. In this Gravel Adventure Guide, we take a closer look at the region and offer a suggested gravel route to experience the mountain.

entry.content:
Dude Builds Upcycled Basket Bike Elevator For His Treehouse

Ethan Schlussler is an upcycling genius as evidenced by this amazing basket bicycle treehouse elevator that he built to access his tree fort system in the northern woods of Idaho. In this video by Kirsten Dirkson we see Ethan describe all the parts and thinking behind the one-of-a-kind bike elevator.
